intro: Oreoporanthera, commonly known as the mountain mallow, is a genus of flowering plants in the mallow family, Malvaceae. It consists of several species native to arid and semi-arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. These plants are characterized by their hairy, glandular leaves and showy, often pink or purple flowers. Oreoporanthera species typically grow in rocky or sandy soils and are adapted to hot, dry climates. They play an important role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for desert wildlife.
